job_title: Therapeutic Recreation Supervisor in Bronx, NY
pros: Family like environment, supportive of individual growth
cons: None I can think of

job_title: Corporate in New York, NY
pros: Can be medically innovative at times. It is always a good feeling to serve the older adults Some shining stars singlehandedly light up the organization on all levels with their hard work and talent.
cons: No transparency and no sincere attention to blind spots. The organization does not want to change. Senior leadership contains some challenging personalities that impact the whole organization. Working on a friendly and competent team can help, but this can be a soul crushing place to work

review_title: Great team ruined by offsite consultants
job_title: Staff RN in New York, NY
pros: Every single one of my on-site coworkers are wonderful to work with.
cons: They have told us at the staff meetings that if we don’t admit more patients that the department will close. This has made me start looking for more stable work as I’m worried the facility will be closing soon. Some of my co-workers think that it is empty threats but I am not certain.

job_title: Director Major Gifts in New York, NY
pros: Great mission, exceptional programs, important healthcare workforce development initiatives, very good healthcare provider
cons: heavy staff churn, unrealistic revenue expectations, weak donor cultivation, serious data hygiene issues, weak grateful patient initiatives

job_title: Director in Rochester, NY
pros: wonderful home to live in
cons: staffing shortages cont to be an issue

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Providing care for the elderly community, in a nursing home and rehab facility is a fulfilling feeling that tugs at your heart strings.
cons: Employees often feel unappreciated and overwhelmed with little management support.

job_title: Social Worker in New York, NY
pros: collegial, manageable workload, approachable managers
cons: some staff are negative and complacent

job_title: Eligibility and Benefits Coordinator in Pomona, NY
pros: Coworkers, Manager, Director of patient's account and Director of revenue cycle are great and helpful.
cons: None. Can't think of something bad to say.

job_title: Cashier in Brooklyn, NY
pros: It’s an amazing job. I would recommend to people
cons: I have no complaints my job was very easy to understand

job_title: Filing Clerk in New York, NY
pros: Very nice environment. Nice staff
cons: a lot of moving around

review_title: Jewish homecare Hapi! Don't do it to yourself!
job_title: Hha in Bronx, NY
pros: This homecare agency is HORRIABLE!! the corrdinators, do not do there job properly, there qwick to throw you under the bus to save there behinds. Your not appreciated as a employe... There always hiring but with no perminte jobs to give. Every other week I seem to always have problems with payroll. As of now they owe me 16 hours from April... Still waiting on that.... O and the nerves of them to get a attitude with me when I call to inquire about money I have worked for dismissive to the highest level. This place is no HAPI!! Zone more like stress.
cons: All around HEADACHE!! I literally, would be so stressed out every payroll... Also with never having a steady case. Corrdinators never pick up there phones all around just a big mess. I speak upon this because multiple coworks complain about the same exact thing. A lot of them do not speak English and I think they take advantage of that.

review_title: One of the best jobs of my career
job_title: Recruitment Department in Bronx, NY
pros: Great leaders/management team and co-workers that are passionate about their jobs and the organzations mission of lifecare. Great work life balance. Management encourgaes growth and development. Forward thinking organzation. I am very pleased to have come here to empower my career and help continue the growth of the organzation. Several of the staff have been around here for 20+ years and many are 10+ years in. That speaks volumes of an organzation. People that come here, stay here for the long haul (and are HAPI too).
cons: No cons what so ever.

review_title: Like riding a psychotic horse toward a burning stable.
job_title: Director in New York, NY
pros: A "family-like" environment, supportive colleagues, wonderful residents, clients, patients and families, longevity of employees.
cons: Too many chiefs and not enough indians.  It is challenging to perform work when you are constantly being called into meetings.  Minutes to most meetings are not distributed.  There is a clear lack of communication from the top down.  Employee morale is terrible.  Plans for long-term expansion exceed day-to-day staffing levels affecting quality of life for residents.

job_title: Accountant in New York, NY
pros:
This review is for the corporate location. Awesome time off benefits. 4 weeks vacation to start (non-union), 12 sick days, and 4 PTO days. 
It is uptown manhattan so there are still many nice spots to eat but the prices are much lower than in mid town. The offices are literally 5 mins walk from central park, riverside park, and a small park that I never found out the name of. These areas are great to take a stroll during lunch or after work. 
The people in my department used to be salaried (and had to work lots of overtime/comp time in order to get things done) but it seems that someone reported them to the DOL so they made us hourly, now no more late evenings. 
I worked in finance. There was no shortage of work. If you want to learn then you definitely will. I got to dabble in different accounting roles as people left ot went on leave
cons:
So many "cons"
Like most other non-profit organizations this place is top heavy. There is a director for everything. The majority of these directors have been with the organization 20+ years. 
Many of them no longer actively contribute anything but just collect a check and let the underpaid younguns do the actual work
JHH has this stupid policy that everyone has to come to work in the event of an emergency (like hurricane sandy). This applies to direct care as well as admin staff, if you don't show up then you will not get paid. 
Well I made it through every emergency except the first 2-3 days of sandy. 
Apparently they expect admin staff to help out with patients if necessary, not on my watch. Nurses get paid a whole lot more than I do

job_title: Support in New York, NY
pros: Corporate office is centrally located in a heart of the city.Public transportation is widely available  and convenient Over all staff is pleasant.They have decent benefits and sick leave available.... and you will need it.
cons: Communication is poor , and 50% of the staff is carrying the work load of the other half. The morale is poor. The Directors do not lead by example and some be have as tyrants, this again lowers morale.  Human resources needs more staff, because they constantly make mistakes with new hires. This environment is only tolerable for per diem work.

review_title: Nice place for HHA's to work at!
job_title: Hha in Bronx, NY
pros: Good union with good benefits and many assignments. When you are recruited, the recruitment staff is very professional and friendly, they treat you with respect, and are there for you should you ever need to get help with assignment too!
cons: client service managers could be nicer. they are bit rough around the edges, but I do not let that bother me.

review_title: Sharpen my skills as customer service and computer input. Very knowledgeable for the type of job I'm seeking.
job_title: Customer Service/Computer Input in Bronx, NY
pros: The staff was very pleasant and helpful.. They assisted me with new computer programs to access patient's personal history. A chance to communicate with nurses and case managers.
cons: Not enough room space for the department I was in. The office was too small. Tables too close to each other.

review_title: Very professional but also warm and encouraging.
job_title: Nurse Manager in New York, NY
pros: Very professional senior management. Thoughtful, sincere and confident. The senior managers have an exceptionally detailed knowledge of the residents in long term care.
cons: No significant "cons" seen so far.

job_title: Associate Director in New York, NY
pros: The only pro is the salary but it's only good if you can ignore all the other mess that is going on around you. In my opinion, it is not worth it!
cons: The morale is terrible, and employees are not respected or appreciated. Management lacks professionalism and is grouped up. If you're not Jewish in this organization/department, then you will not last. I have witnessed Jewish employees make big mistakes, but their mistakes are overlooked and blamed on others. The administration has shown a pattern of when its time to let go of an employee they spread the word throughout the department, which makes the person who is being let go feel inhuman. That person is then asked to announce in front of the department that they have "resigned to pursue other opportunities. " I never worked for a company that treated employees this way. You know you are about to get fired a whole month or so before management decides to come to you because of the unprofessionalism of management. Everyone is privileged to the information. If your thinking about an opportunity with this organization, run the other way, but if your Jewish, you may have a great opportunity there. Note, though, that management has a history of firing all existing employees and bring in their own. The New Jewish Home does not stand for its values at all.

review_title: JHL is a company with good values and a supportive staff.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: JHL staff truly care about their clients. From the CNAs to the Senior Staff, they will go out of their way to make sure that JHL residents are comfortable and safe.
cons: Sometimes the traditional culture gets in the way of modernizing the organization.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Some of the staff are friendly, great benefits good time off plan for employees. Good caring nurses, if they get the tools they need to exceed at their proffession.
cons: Very unprofessional, upper directors are not professional to lower staff, pay is the worst. There is no recognition for employees who actually work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: security, benefits, team work, amicable work environment among lower echelon of msnsgement
cons: very low pay, rigid schedule, too much work always, very hectic, inaccessible executive body, rigid corporate structure, no chances for growth; old buildings with Dickensonian interior design

job_title: Corporate in New York, NY
pros: There is nothing positive about working here
cons:
To begin with they saw one thing to get you to accept the job, then change it before you even start, and to add insult to injury they let you go on thinking it's one way while it isnt.

The working conditions are disgusting, mice and bugs in the work area. There is no communication with superiors. They allow for sexual harassment in the workplace.

review_title: My experience at Jewish Home Lifecare was a positive one.

Fast paced work, goal driven organization.
cons:

Lack of appropriate training for employees transferred interdepartmentally
